intro: Prangos turbinata, commonly known as the Turban Squill, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaryllis family (Amaryllidaceae) and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a tall, leafless stem that bears the flowers at the top, often with a single bloom per stem. Prangos turbinata is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
